'All Of Us Should Be Ashamed': Madras HC Says Anna University Sexual Assault Case Being Politicised - News18
summary:
Madras HC Condemns Politicization of Anna University Sexual Assault Case

Date: January 02, 2025 | Source: News18

In a recent statement, the Madras High Court expressed its dismay over the Anna University sexual assault case, indicating that the issue is being politicized rather than being addressed with genuine concern.

  • The Madras High Court criticized the police for mishandling the case and allowing politically motivated protests.
  • Justice P. Velmurugan expressed that the case should serve as a wake-up call about societal issues.
  • The incident involves the sexual assault of a 19-year-old engineering student on December 23, which has garnered significant media attention.
  • The court formed an all-women Special Investigation Team to investigate the case.
  • Interim compensation of ₹25 lakhs has been ordered for the survivor.
“All of us should be ashamed. Strictly speaking, we all are co-accused in such crimes.” - Justice P. Velmurugan

The court's remarks emphasize the need for serious societal reflection on attitudes towards gender and caste discrimination and the responsibilities of media and political entities in addressing such grave issues.
newTitle: Madras HC Condemns Politicization of Anna University Sexual Assault Case

title: Karnataka: Woman kills husband, smashes his face with stone, chops body - Hindustan Times
summary:
Woman Arrested for Murdering Husband, Disposing Body in Karnataka

Date: Jan 02, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

A woman in Karnataka's Belagavi was arrested for allegedly murdering her husband and chopping his body, police said on Thursday.

  • The woman allegedly strangled her 40-year-old husband, identified as Srimantha Itnali, and then smashed his face with a stone.
  • She cut his body into two pieces to dispose of it away from her house.
  • The incident took place on December 8, and the body was found on December 10 in Umarani village in Chikkodi taluk of Belagavi.
  • The police initially did not suspect the woman, but later brought her in for questioning, and she confessed to the crime.
  • The husband was reportedly a drunkard who abused his wife for money and wanted her to sell a piece of land to buy him a new motorbike.
"She first strangled him and when he was unconscious, used a boulder lying nearby to smash his face. She then disposed of the boulder in a well."

The woman has been taken into custody.
newTitle: Woman Arrested for Murdering Husband, Disposing Body in Karnataka

Article 370 caused spread of terrorism in Kashmir: Amit Shah - The Hindu
summary:
Amit Shah: Article 370 Fueled Terrorism in Kashmir

Published on: January 02, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

Union Home Minister Amit Shah claims that Article 370 has played a critical role in fostering terrorism in Kashmir, attributing it to the notion of temporary relations between Kashmir and India.

  • Article 370 fostered separatism among Kashmiri youth, leading to terrorism.
  • Other Muslim-majority regions in India did not experience similar terrorism despite sharing borders with Pakistan.
  • Mr. Shah stated that the misconception of Kashmir's relationship with India promoted extremism.
  • The revocation of Article 370 on August 5, 2019, must be understood in the larger historical context.

“Why did terrorism not spread in other Muslim areas of the country? ... It is unfortunate that 40,000 people lost their lives,” Mr. Shah said.

The Home Minister further emphasized the importance of re-evaluating Kashmir's history and offered perspectives that could reshape national narratives.
newTitle: Amit Shah: Article 370 Fueled Terrorism in Kashmir

In a surprising turn of events, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar publicly responded to an invitation extended by Lalu Prasad Yadav regarding the INDIA bloc, stirring political discussions across the state.

title: Noida: Schools closed for classes up to 8 due to cold wave - Hindustan Times
summary:
Noida Schools Closed for Classes Up to 8 Due to Cold Wave

Published on: Jan 02, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Due to severe cold wave conditions, schools in Noida will remain closed for classes up to eighth until further notice, affecting all educational boards.

  • Closure applies to all schools in Noida across state, CBSE, and ICSE boards.
  • Decision taken by district magistrate Manish Kumar Verma on health concerns for children.
  • Minimum temperature in Noida has dropped to around 8 degrees Celsius.
  • Schools must comply with the order or face strict action.
  • Weather predictions indicate ongoing cold conditions with likelihood of fog and mist from January 3 to 6.
“The severe cold intensifying over the last few days would cause problems for the children coming to school in the morning.” - Rahul Panwar, District Education Officer

The closure aims to ensure the safety of students during extreme weather, marking a continued response to fluctuating conditions in the region.
newTitle: Noida Schools Closed for Classes Up to 8 Due to Cold Wave

title: High-level meeting held; government shortlists Ekta Sthal, Vijay Ghat for Manmohan Singh’s memorial - The Indian Express
summary:
Government Shortlists Sites for Manmohan Singh's Memorial

Date: January 2, 2025 | Source: The Indian Express

Top officials from the Ministry of Home Affairs and the Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs met to identify potential sites for a memorial for former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh.

  • Two sites shortlisted: Ekta Sthal and Vijay Ghat.
  • Ekta Sthal is near Jawaharlal Nehru’s samadhi, while Vijay Ghat is near Mahatma Gandhi’s memorial.
  • The selection comes after the Congress party's request for a memorial following Singh's death on December 26.
  • Urban Development Secretary will inform Singh’s family about the proposed sites and establish a Trust for land allocation.
  • Former Congress leaders criticized the government's choice of location for Singh's last rites.
“The government’s choice of location had disrespected the former Prime Minister’s legacy.”

The announcement of the final memorial site is awaited, as public discourse continues regarding the appropriateness of the chosen locations.
newTitle: Government Shortlists Sites for Manmohan Singh's Memorial

title: DSP Gursher Sandhu dismissed for facilitating Lawrence Bishnoi interview - The Indian Express
summary:
DSP Gursher Sandhu Dismissed for Facilitating Gangster Interview

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] Source: [Insert Source Here]

The Punjab Government has dismissed Deputy Superintendent of Police Gursher Singh Sandhu for facilitating the recording of an interview with notorious gangster Lawrence Bishnoi while he was in police custody.

  • Sandhu facilitated interviews with Bishnoi while he was held by the CIA in Kharar.
  • The interviews were aired on a private news channel in March 2023.
  • The dismissal orders were issued by the Secretary of the Department of Home Affairs.
  • Sandhu was under suspension since October 25, 2024, and evaded receiving a chargesheet.
  • The Punjab Public Service Commission approved Sandhu's dismissal under Article 311(2)(b) of the Indian Constitution.
“After careful consideration of the facts and circumstances, the state government is satisfied that Gursher Singh Sandhu has severely dented the image of the Punjab Police through his actions,” stated the dismissal order.

The decision to dismiss Sandhu is seen as a move to restore the credibility of the Punjab Police following significant misconduct by officers involved in the case.
newTitle: DSP Gursher Sandhu Dismissed for Facilitating Gangster Interview

Union Carbide waste disposal in Pithampur won’t harm environment, says M.P. CM Mohan Yadav - The Hindu
summary:
Union Carbide waste disposal in Pithampur won’t harm environment, says M.P. CM Mohan Yadav

Date: January 02, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Mohan Yadav stated that the disposal of toxic waste from the Union Carbide factory in Bhopal will not negatively impact the environment at its incineration site in Pithampur. This waste, weighing 337 tonnes, had been a concern due to past pollution fears.

  • The waste is set for disposal at a facility in Pithampur, 35 km from Indore.
  • The disposal is carried out following court directives using scientific methods.
  • 60% of the waste is soil, with 40% consisting of chemicals like naphthalene.
  • The incineration process has previously shown no environmental impact.
“For the last 40 years, the people of Bhopal have been living with this waste.” - M.P. CM Mohan Yadav

In conclusion, the Chief Minister reassured that the long-standing waste issue is being resolved with appropriate measures to ensure safety for the environment and residents.
newTitle: Union Carbide Waste Disposal in Pithampur Declared Safe by M.P. CM

title: Mira Bhayandar: 23-Year-Old Youth Killed After Argument Over Songs At New Years Party In Kashimira; - Free Press Journal
summary:
Fatal New Year's Dispute: 23-Year-Old Dies After Brawl Over Songs in Mumbai

Date & Source: Thursday, January 2, 2025 - Mid-Day

Introduction: A 23-year-old, Raja Pariyar, succumbed to injuries after being brutally assaulted during a New Year's party in Mumbai's Kashimira. The assault stemmed from a dispute over playing songs.

  1. Pariyar and a group of friends were celebrating New Year's Eve.
  2. A heated argument broke out between Pariyar and Ashish Jadhav over playing Bhojpuri numbers.
  3. Jadhav returned with five others and assaulted Pariyar and his friend Vipul Rai.
  4. Pariyar was rushed to the hospital but died after battling for life for nearly 24 hours.
  5. Three assailants, including the prime accused, were arrested, while three others remain at large.
The assault is said to be the fall-out of a petty tiff between two groups over playing songs.

Conclusion: The incident highlights the tragic consequences of trivial arguments escalating into violence.
newTitle: Fatal New Year's Dispute: 23-Year-Old Dies After Brawl Over Songs in Mumbai

title: 'Close Aide Murdered': Mamata Banerjee After TMC Leader Shot Dead In Bengal's Malda - News18
summary:
Mamata Banerjee Grieves the Murder of Close Aide Dulal Sarkar in Malda

Date: January 02, 2025 Source: News18

Trinamool Congress leader Dulal Sarkar was tragically shot dead in Malda district, West Bengal. The incident occurred in broad daylight as he was heading to his factory, leading to a wave of shock and condemnation from party leaders, particularly Mamata Banerjee.

  • Dulal Sarkar, also known as Babla, was shot by assailants on motorcycles in front of witnesses.
  • Mamata Banerjee described him as a close associate and expressed her grief publicly.
  • The incident raised serious concerns about the security oversight in the region, with Banerjee blaming police negligence.
  • Banerjee confirmed that Sarkar’s security cover had been removed prior to the attack.
  • Trinamool leaders are demanding immediate action from the police.
My close associate, and a very popular leader, Babla Sarkar has been murdered today. From the beginning of the Trinamool Congress, he (and his wife Chaitali Sarkar) worked hard for the party. I am sad and hugely shocked after knowing about the incident. The culprits must be booked immediately. — Mamata Banerjee

The tragic event highlights ongoing issues of safety and security for political leaders in the area, sparking calls for reform and immediate investigations.
newTitle: Mamata Banerjee Grieves the Murder of Close Aide Dulal Sarkar in Malda

title: Land Acquisition Compensation - In Exceptional Cases, Courts Can Direct Market Value Be Determined Based... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Allows Shift in Land Acquisition Compensation Date Amidst Delays

Date: January 2, 2025 Source: Live Law

The Supreme Court today addressed the determination of land acquisition compensation, emphasizing that while compensation should be set at the market rate upon notification, exceptional delays may warrant reevaluation based on later dates to ensure fair treatment of landowners.

  • The case arose from a challenge to the Karnataka High Court's refusal to adjust the compensation date for land taken in 2005, arguing significant delays affected the market value.
  • The Court agreed that compensation dating could be shifted in cases of inordinate delays, underscoring the importance of timely disbursal as per the Land Acquisition Act, 1894.
  • Justice Gavai reiterated the need for higher courts to oversee such adjustments rather than administrative bodies like the Special Land Acquisition Officer (SLAO).
  • Notable precedent was referenced, highlighting violations of landowners' property rights due to delayed compensation payments.
  • The final ruling mandated that compensation calculations revert to the market value as of April 22, 2019, with necessary legal benefits for the landowners.
“The value of money is based on the idea that money can be invested to earn a return, and that the purchasing power of money decreases over time due to inflation.”

In conclusion, the Court’s decision affirms the need for fairness in land acquisition processes, advocating for timely compensation to protect the rights of affected landowners.
newTitle: Supreme Court Allows Shift in Land Acquisition Compensation Date Amidst Delays

title: Supreme Court to hear plea against ASI survey of Bhojshala along with Places of Worship Act case - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court to hear plea against ASI survey of Bhojshala along with Places of Worship Act case

Published on: 02 Jan 2025, 1:44 pm

The petition challenging the Madhya Pradesh High Court's decision on the Bhojshala complex survey is now set to be reviewed alongside cases regarding the validity of the Places of Worship Act, 1991.

  • The Supreme Court will examine the implications of the ASI survey concerning the religious character of the Bhojshala complex.
  • The case was tagged with petitions regarding the Places of Worship Act.
  • Current status quo orders by the Chief Justice indicate that no further action is needed for now.
  • Concerns about violations of previous court directives regarding excavations at the site were raised.
"Since the order was passed by CJI-led Bench, nothing further needs to be done." - Justice Roy

The ongoing legal battle reflects tensions surrounding the religious identity of the Bhojshala complex, with significant implications for both Hindu and Muslim communities in the region.
newTitle: Supreme Court to Review ASI Survey of Bhojshala and Places of Worship Act

title: DSP Gursher dismissed for facilitating Bishnois interview from custody - The Tribune India
summary:
Punjab Dismisses Police Officer Gursher Sandhu Over Gangster Interview

Date: Thursday

Source: The Tribune

The Punjab government has dismissed Deputy Superintendent of Police Gursher Singh Sandhu for facilitating a video interview of gangster Lawrence Bishnoi while in custody, which the government claims damaged the image of the police department.

  • Gursher Sandhu was dismissed after a decision by the Punjab Public Service Commission.
  • Lawrence Bishnoi is linked to the Sidhu Moosewala case and has multiple criminal charges against him.
  • The Punjab and Haryana High Court ordered action against police officials involved in facilitating the interview.
  • Six other police officials also faced suspension pending further reviews.
  • There are ongoing investigations into senior officers' involvement related to the interview.
The orders noted a severe dent to the department's image due to Sandhu's misconduct.

This dismissal reflects ongoing scrutiny within the Punjab Police regarding accountability and misconduct.
newTitle: Punjab Dismisses Police Officer Gursher Sandhu Over Gangster Interview

title: ‘Name It After Manmohan Singh’: BJP-Congress Political Row Over DU’s New Savarkar College Escalates - News18
summary:
‘Name It After Manmohan Singh’: BJP-Congress Political Row Over DU’s New Savarkar College Escalates

Date: January 03, 2025, Source: News18

The establishment of Veer Savarkar College at Delhi University has ignited a significant political debate between the BJP and Congress. The proposal from Congress to name the college after late Prime Minister Manmohan Singh marks a contentious development.

  • The college will be built in Roshanpura, Najafgarh, with an estimated cost of Rs 140 crore.
  • Prime Minister Narendra Modi is expected to lay the foundation stone, as part of larger investment plans exceeding Rs 600 crore for Delhi University.
  • Congress criticizes the move, claiming it legitimizes Veer Savarkar’s controversial role.
  • NSUI demands the college's name change to honor Dr. Manmohan Singh, claiming that his contributions to education should be recognized.
  • BJP defends the naming of the college, reiterating Savarkar's status as a freedom fighter.
“It would have been good if the college was named after freedom fighters who laid down their lives for the country.” - Congress MP Naseer Hussain

The argument reflects broader tensions between the two parties, emphasizing differing interpretations of historical figures and their contributions to India's freedom struggle.
newTitle: BJP and Congress Clash Over Naming of New DU College

title: Karnataka hikes bus fares by 15%, effective January 5 - CNBCTV18
summary:
Karnataka Increases Bus Fares by 15% Effective January 5

Date: Jan 2, 2025 | Source: CNBC TV18

The Karnataka government has announced a 15% increase in bus fares, effective January 5, in response to rising operational costs linked to fuel prices and staff expenses.

  • The fare increase applies to all four state transport corporations in Karnataka.
  • The last fare revision for BMTC was in 2015.
  • Daily diesel expenditure has increased from ₹9.16 crore to ₹13.21 crore.
  • Staff costs rose from ₹12.95 crore to ₹18.36 crore.
  • The ‘Shakti’ scheme ensuring free travel for women will remain unchanged.
“After the rise by 15%, we will be lesser than any of these states,” - H K Patil, Karnataka Law and Parliamentary Affairs Minister.

This fare hike is seen as a necessary measure due to significant operational cost increases, ensuring that public transport remains viable in the state.
newTitle: Karnataka Increases Bus Fares by 15% Effective January 5

title: 'TMC Not Guarding Borders': Mamata Banerjee Says BSF Allowing Bangladeshi Infiltration, BJP Retorts - News18
UP man lands in Pakistan jail after illegally crossing border to marry ‘Facebook’ lover, his family seeks PM Modi's help - Hindustan Times
summary:
UP Man Lands in Pakistan Jail After Illegally Crossing Border to Marry ‘Facebook’ Lover, His Family Seeks PM Modi's Help

Publication Date: January 2, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

A 21-year-old man from Uttar Pradesh is in a Pakistani jail after attempting to cross the border for a relationship that took a turn for the worse. His family is seeking help from Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

  • The man, Badal Babu, informed his family he was going to Delhi for work but instead crossed the border near Jammu.
  • His family learned of his situation after a video call, which he made using a friend's phone.
  • He was arrested in Mandi Bahauddin, Pakistan, and was trying to meet a girl named Sana Rani.
  • Rani has reportedly stated she is not interested in marrying Babu.
  • The family has appealed to the Indian government for assistance in securing his release.
  • Babu has been placed under judicial custody for 14 days.
"We want our son back and we don't know how to bring him home. We are calling on the prime minister to help us." - Badal Babu's mother

The incident highlights the complexities of cross-border relationships and the legal challenges faced by individuals attempting to navigate such situations.
newTitle: Uttar Pradesh Man Arrested in Pakistan After Crossing Border for Love
